### [Mar 3] Glenn County is currently vaccinating Phase 1A and 1B
Phase 1A
- Healthcare workers
- Long-term care residents
Phase 1B
- Individuals 65 yrs +
- Emergency services
- Healthcare personnel
- IHSS caregivers
- Crisis workers
- Education professionals
- Licensed childcare providers
- Food and Agricultural workers

Glenn County Public Health has rolled out a new online system for residents eligible for COVID-19 vaccine. 
•     Persons meeting the current vaccine eligibility criteria should go to our website and complete a Vaccine Interest Survey.
[Countyofglenn.net/COVID19](http://countyofglenn.net/COVID19?fbclid=IwAR2bROtZKTF-z38fgNJDxUxPlFqFzEv_hYmPREpAjFBxjSy6z-9O_MCKVFk) then select Vaccine information tab in either English or Spanish 
• Once a resident has completed the online Vaccine Survey of Interest Form, Public Health staff will pull the contact information by batch and complete return calls or emails to schedule an appointment for upcoming clinics
•     If you do not have internet access, you may call Public Health at 530-934-6588. One of our staff will assist you with completing the vaccine Interest Survey by phone. Calling Public Health will NOT get you ahead of the line or an automatic appointment. It will give you equal access to the Vaccine Interest Survey only.

Persons 65 years of age and older, please click here to complete this survey: [https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx...](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=tLm4xI910UKrfXq7srhj-bYz39SBbv5ChxPkY-fjih9UOUhZTldYNDNYOTNSOTRIN0VDQkRCVUdLSy4u&fbclid=IwAR1SuvYKmM8Ktd9Rr2cjbMCtdybg_1EvPhvl3bNIiyvqDN6JW5IN2HNauHI) 
Persons working in Glenn County in workforce sectors: Emergency Services, Education & Childcare, and Food and Agriculture, please click here to complete this survey: 
[https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx...](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=tLm4xI910UKrfXq7srhj-bYz39SBbv5ChxPkY-fjih9UMVg2Qko0Mk81UFRZVzVLS1lPSzZSNzlTRS4u&fbclid=IwAR3xx6dhUHRFVgE7wxpb46yMRqfD2WR6Q5yIDdl7uBnBKVK8ggn1wre1tuk) 

Info also available via email COVID@countyofglenn.net or by visiting [www.countyofglenn.net/COVID19](https://www.countyofglenn.net/COVID19?fbclid=IwAR1aVRZUWm7sMJIYfGl8TpMa4yLVFIWtiSH32s6M5g3CTz9QOdBLdWhzP-8)

Información Sobre La Vacuna COVID 19: [Información Sobre La Vacuna COVID 19 | County of Glenn](https://www.countyofglenn.net/dept/health-human-services/public-health/covid-19/informaci%C3%B3n-sobre-la-vacuna-covid-19)

**Previous Updates:**

[Feb 21]
Currently, there are NO open 1st dose appointments for February. They will announce by the end of February when vaccine appointments are available for March and where to go to sign up for an appointment.

[Feb 9]  Currently vaccinating people in Phase 1A (healthcare workers, long-term care facilities) and Phase 1B tier 1 (people 75 and older, workers in education, child care, emergency services).

Taking appointments at four Safeways: <https://www.co.shasta.ca.us/ready/covid-19/vaccinations>

Information on additional locations here:
<https://www.co.shasta.ca.us/docs/libraries/shasta-ready-docs/covid-19/vaccine-options.pdf?sfvrsn=a716f589_0>

If you don’t see an option that works for you and if you are eligible now, there are two ways to get on the list to be scheduled for an appointment.
1. You can select the blue oval labeled “Tell me when it’s my turn” and complete the short survey,
2. or if you don’t have internet access, call (530) 245-7890.

Both options will get you on one master list, and Public Health will call or email you to set up an appointment.

Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Shasta.html>

### [Feb 9] **Vaccinating last of Phase 1A and have moved into Phase 1B, Tier 1** 
### 
"We have completed most of the education sector and are vaccinating those 70 and older. 
We will be moving into the licensed childcare and emergency services sectors and planning for the food and agriculture sector, while continuing to vaccinate those 70 and older and moving downward. "

Vaccines are allocated by the State according to permanent resident population, so vaccination appointments are **only for** **people who work or live in Tuolumne County, regardless of immigration status. **To ensure Tuolumne County is administering vaccines according to State guidelines, **proof of eligibility is now required at the vaccination clinics**. 

### **Where:**
Vaccine is being administered primarily at Closed Points of Dispensing (PODs) **by appointment.** You can find most recent locations compiled by our volunteers, by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Tuolumne.html>

Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for vaccine information and to check for availability.
### How to Make an Appointment:
If you are in an eligible Phase and Tier, you can fill out the Tuolumne County COVID-19 Vaccination **Interest Form** at <https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=f7_iN8RLhUCeCq6rg_E6Hg1TRUz5AN9Fh5_US45ucbRUNUpEMk1MQ0Y1QkcwMjY3TE5YS1hHUkZaUi4u>. Public Health staff will follow up with you when vaccine becomes available and an appointment slot opens up.
### County status:
Shipments of Pfizer and Moderna vaccine have been received in Tuolumne County and we continue to receive additional shipments of first and second doses, primarily the Moderna vaccine. Some of the vaccine was redistributed to our neighboring counties as part of the statewide distribution plan, and vaccinations have been administered to individuals according to the State's [phased plan](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/#When-can-I-get-vaccinated). More shipments of vaccine are expected in the coming weeks and months, yet the situation remains fluid. As new details become available regarding COVID-19 vaccines, Tuolumne County Public Health will update the information on the [county website](https://www.tuolumnecounty.ca.gov/1317/COVID-Vaccine).

[Mar 4] Vaccinating Phase 1A, and Phase 1b Tier 1, including Education and childcare, Agriculture and food manufacturing workers, Emergency services, and Grocery and restaurant workers

A list of clinics open to Sonoma County residents is available here: <https://socoemergency.org/emergency/novel-coronavirus/vaccine-information/clinics/>

Questions or concerns? Call 2-1-1 or text your zip code to 898-211 to talk/text with a call taker 24/7. Pre-recorded information and resources can be found by texting "COVID19" to 211211.

March 4   NOW VACCINATING Healthcare workers and long-term-care residents
NOW VACCINATING AS SUPPLIES ALLOW Individuals 65 and older, agriculture and food, education and childcare, emergency services

Go to  [myturn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov/) to schedule or register to be notified when eligible. Or you can call (833) 422-4255 to schedule.

County vaccine information web page has links to appointment scheduling pages for various healthcare providers.

[March 4] Individuals are eligible to be vaccinated in Madera County for those who live OR work in Madera County only. 
Currently, the following groups of people are eligible:
- Ages 65 + 
- Health Care Workers (age 16+)
- Long-Term Care staff and residents (age 16+)
- Medical first responders(age 16+)
- [Emergency Services](https://covid19.ca.gov/essential-workforce/) (age 16+)
- [Food & Ag](https://covid19.ca.gov/essential-workforce/) (age 16+)
- Educational Institutions (age 16+)
- Licensed Childcare - (age 16+)

Certain High-Risk Patients may be eligible based upon this [guidance](https://www.maderacounty.com/home/showpublisheddocument?id=25503). A [physician referral form](https://www.maderacounty.com/home/showpublisheddocument?id=25757) must be submitted, reviewed, and approved PRIOR to making an appointment as stated in the instructions _(Once physician submits referral to public health, allow 3 business days for review)._

Due to the mandatory 15 minute observation period after being vaccinated, only patients who can enter the building will receive a vaccination through the county.

Only those eligible will be vaccinated - an appointment is not a guarantee of vaccination.

**REQUIRED:** Bring proof of eligibility to your appointment - Age, Address, Verification of Eligibility. _MCDPH will not copy or retain eligibility information._ 
Madera County Department of Public Health follows [guidelines provided by the state](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/#California's-vaccination-plan).  
\*MCDPH will not copy or retain eligibility information. Proof of eligibility used for visual verification only by clinic screeners. 
### To make an appointment:
To make an appointment for the FIRST VACCINE, fill out the form at:
[Online Survey Software | Qualtrics Survey Solutions](https://qaz1.az1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_6MB5PrXgaf6OWrj)
To make an appointment for the SECOND VACCINE, fill out the form at:
[Online Survey Software | Qualtrics Survey Solutions](https://qaz1.az1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0ixfK3exgfQ3P1Q)
Individuals can also check availability and sign up for the Overflow List.
Overflow registration helps reduce vaccine waste at the end of each clinic by creating a standby list -  [find out more](https://www.maderacounty.com/Admin/Components/Page/EditDesign?navid=1158). 

### To sign up for notifications:
Clinic dates are added when vaccine is received from the state; at that time the registration link will be reopened.  
Text MADERAVAX to 888777 for a text alert, or check back often to see when the link is reposted. 
Questions? Call 311 or use the [community feedback form](https://www.maderacounty.com/government/public-health/health-updates/corona-virus/covid-19-faqs-and-community-feedback-form).

### [Mar 2] Vaccinating 65+ and Phase 1B from Mar 3rd

Beginning March 3, 2021, the following Monterey County residents will be eligible to receive COVID-19 vaccine:
- Health care workers, long-term care residents, and emergency services personnel (continued)
- Residents 65 years and older not previously vaccinated
- All residents who are at risk of exposure while working in food, agriculture, childcare, education, and emergency services (visit California Department of Health website for a [list of critical infrastructure workers](https://covid19.ca.gov/essential-workforce/) included in these industry sectors).

Vaccine appointments are for those living and working in Monterey County and are members of the phase and tier currently being vaccinated. Individuals will be asked for proof of employment as a health care worker or age over 65 years upon arrival at the vaccination appointment.

Monterey County’s vaccine appointment registration website will be updated as clinics are scheduled: <https://www.co.monterey.ca.us/government/departments-a-h/health/diseases/2019-novel-coronavirus-covid-19/2019-novel-coronavirus-covid-19-vaccines>
Please note that individuals will be required to show proof of eligibility when presenting for community-based vaccination appointments.

The county is encouraging people to sign up to receive updates from the county about eligibility and vaccine supply status by filling out the form at <https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=qsBxyiig7EOMMAVrYO10FMw4msASlr5Ct5BLe66TX99URDFONldOWFVOMVY3QTAzMVJMM1BZRFVPNC4u>.

## To make an appointment:
Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider and their employer for vaccine information and to check for availability.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Monterey.html>

## To sign up for notifications:
You can sign up to receive updates from the county by filling out the form at <https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=qsBxyiig7EOMMAVrYO10FMw4msASlr5Ct5BLe66TX99URDFONldOWFVOMVY3QTAzMVJMM1BZRFVPNC4u>. 

## For more information:
For questions call the Monterey County COVID-19 Call Center at [831-769-8700 ](tel:831-769-8700)or email [covid-19@co.monterey.ca.us.](mailto:covid-19@co.monterey.ca.us)

You can also follow the Monterey County Health Department on Twitter at <https://twitter.com/mchdpio>.

# [Jan 25] Vaccinating Healthcare workers, and people 65 years and older

As of Jan 22, Tehama County changed their distribution plan to prioritize healthcare workers and 65+ (previously they were following the phase/tier approach)

Appointments are required.

## To make an appointment: 
Individuals who are eligible are encouraged to register via the form at <https://www.tehamacohealthservices.net/covid-19/covid-vaccine/>

You may also call the Tehama County Health Services Agency Public Health line at (530) 527-6824 and leave a voicemail message. Due to the overwhelming number of calls coming through our telephone system, if you have internet access the preferred way to submit your
required information is the online form.

Note: County urges individuals  to only submit one request as multiple requests will not expedite your COVID-19 vaccine request and may cause a significant delay in processing. The appointment scheduling is dependent on the limited supply of vaccine and they continue to work urgently with our federal and state partners to expand capacity and supply.

Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Tehama.html>

## For more information:
The county is accepting questions at publichealth@tchsa.net or by phone at (530) 527-6824.

March 4   Yolo County Clinics   currently vaccinating  65 or older AND live in Yolo County ,Work in education, childcare, emergency services, or the food and agricultural industries AND live or work in Yolo County or

Healthcare providers and pharmacies are also vaccinating Yolo County residents but may have different eligibility requirements.Individuals who are 65+ are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

### [Feb 27]: Currently vaccinating Phase 1a Tiers 1-3, and part of Phase 1b Tier 1. Residents 65 and older and Healthcare Workers are among those eligible. 

From the County website:
**There are currently no first dose community vaccination clinics scheduled through the county. First Dose clinics will be scheduled based on vaccine supply and allocations for Butte County.**

The County is just beginning the process of offering second doses of the vaccine. The county asks that the public please be patient during this process and understand that everyone who received their first dose is guaranteed a second dose.

**Vaccine Scheduling Hotline:**
For residents without internet, you may call the Vaccine Scheduling Hotline for assistance – **please reserve this line for those without internet. **Calling the hotline WILL NOT book your appointment faster. If you have internet, scheduling your second dose is fast and easy.

- The hotline is currently closed and will re-open when new clinics are available for scheduling.

**If you received your first dose Feb 1 – 4**
- Individuals who received their first dose from the Enloe clinic at _2454 Builders Place Chico, CA _from February 1 to February 4.  Please **[schedule online](https://www.signupgenius.com/go/4090A4FADAE2DAAF58-march)** or call 530-552-3020 to schedule your second dose. Second doses will be administered on **March 1 to March 4.**
- You must bring your CDC COVID Vaccination Card to your second dose appointment. If you misplaced your card, staff will be onsite with computer access to verify your first dose.
For more information about upcoming clinics and to check on who is currently being vaccinated, visit: 
<http://www.buttecounty.net/ph/COVID19/vaccine>

[Feb 22] Beginning today Feb. 22, the County of San Mateo will expand COVID-19 vaccinations to teachers and child care providers, first responders and food and agricultural workers who are eligible under the state’s Phase 1B as supply allows.

This in addition to vaccinating health care workers, residents of long-term care facilities and persons over 65.

If you are 65 or older, you can check with your usual health care provider to see if they have vaccine available.

The county page at <https://www.smchealth.org/covidvaccine> has contact information for major health systems in San Mateo County.

Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/san_mateo.html>.

# [Feb 22] Phase 1A, 1B and residents 65+

- Phase 1A (direct healthcare workers and residents of long-term care facilities) who work in Yuba-Sutter Counties
- Phase 1B (Food/Agriculture, Education/Childcare and Emergency Service Workers who are _50 years and older_) who work in Yuba-Sutter Counties
- Persons aged 65 years and older who live in Yuba-Sutter Counties

# [Feb 4] - Vaccinating Phase 1B-Tier 1 (65+) And Residents 55 Years And Older With Underlying Health Conditions And Pregnant Women
Phase 1b Tier 1 includes:
- People aged 65 years or older. People 75 years and older are prioritized.
- Workers in education, childcare, emergency services (non-medical first responders: law enforcement and fire), and food and agriculture (grocery store, restaurant workers, and farm workers). 

Vaccinating Mono County residents only. 

The county asks to you please do not arrive at any clinic unless you have an appointment. On-site registration is not available at this time. 

## To make an appointment:
Appointments can be made once you have received an invitation. You can pre-register for an invitation by filling out the county's confidential questionnaire at <https://webapps.mono.ca.gov/covid19/vaccinate-mono-form/>.

If you are unable to complete the vaccine questionnaire online or by phone, or you have questions, you can contact the county at COVID19help@mono.ca.gov or call 760-924-1830

Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Mono.html> 

Para preinscribirse para una cita, complete el formulario confidencial del condado en <https://webapps.mono.ca.gov/covid19/vaccinate-mono-form/>. El formulario está disponible en español. 

Personas que son elegibles para vacunarse se recomienda que se comuniquen con su proveedor de atención médica personal para obtener información sobre la vacuna y verificar la disponibilidad.

## To sign up for notifications:
You can preregister for a vaccine by filling out a confidential questionnaire with the Mono County Public Health Department to help them prioritize COVID-19 immunizations per the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and California Department of Public Health (CDPH) guidelines. The form is available at <https://webapps.mono.ca.gov/covid19/vaccinate-mono-form/>.

If you are unable to complete the vaccine questionnaire online or by phone, or you have questions, you can contact the county at COVID19help@mono.ca.gov. 

## County status: 
From a 1/11 press release: To date, Mono County and Mammoth Hospital have received a combined 969 doses of the PfizerBioNTech and Moderna vaccines, with more doses expected to arrive in the near future. Over 300 Mammoth Hospital employees and medical personnel who elected to receive the vaccination have been inoculated with their first dose. Mammoth Hospital will not be immunizing the general public at
this time, only some of the people identified in Phase 1B. All COVID-19 vaccinations will be conducted by the Mono County Public Health Department. 

You can read the rest of the press release at <https://webapps.mono.ca.gov/COVIDDocs//PressReleases/PR_MONO%20COUNTY%20PUBLIC%20HEALTH%20PROVIDES%20UPDATE%20ON%20VACCINE%20PRIORITIZATION%20AND%20DISTRIBUTION_1-11-2021.pdf>

Sierra County Public Health will confirm receipt of your request and will call you when they are ready to schedule your appointment. 

Copies of the Vaccination Registration Card can be found at the post office, Sierra County Offices, Loyalton Schools, Downieville Schools, The Family Resource Center and Grocery stores. 

Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Sierra.html>

[Mar 4] Siskiyou County is vaccinating residents 65+ as well as people who are in Phase 1a or 1b, tier 1 (healthcare workers, teachers, emergency services, childcare providers, and agriculture).

At this time, Siskiyou County Public Health is not maintaining a waitlist. Visit <https://www.co.siskiyou.ca.us/publichealth/page/covid-19-vaccine-information>  and click on the CalVax Providers button to see options for receiving the vaccine.

Residents are encouraged to visit Siskiyou County Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/siskiyoucountyph/) for updates as to when and how you will be able to receive the vaccine.

For questions or concerns please call (530) 841-2134 or email phinfo@co.siskiyou.ca.us.

[Mar 4] Currently vaccinating Phase 1A, and (when supply allows) those 65 years of age and older and those at risk of exposure at work in the following sectors: education, childcare, emergency services, and food and agriculture.

Before your scheduled appointment, please have the following ready: [click here](https://www.icphd.org/media/managed/0covid19vaccine/Vaccine_Registration_Questions_.pdf)

Phone assistance at 442-265-1444, will be available Monday through Friday from 8:00 am to 12:00 pm and 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm. The office will be closed for lunch from 12:00 pm to 1:00 pm 

Persons 65 and older who may need additional assistance, please contact the Area Agency on Aging at 442-265-7033 or 442-265-7040

[Mar 4]: Inyo County is currently vaccinating all Priority 1A residents; and has begun Priority 1B Tier 1 Residents. 

Inyo residents can enter their information to get on the COVID-19 vaccine list. You will receive updates on vaccine rollout and will be contacted when vaccine appointments are available for people in your priority tier. 
**[COVID Vaccine Registration](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfxml4iOjuCy2dwsppYDHK-bpCbZA2uU0lM699zlVtllE7o5Q/viewform)**

**Who is being vaccinated NOW?  **
- **Individuals aged 65 and older**
- **Healthcare workers**
- **Non-medical first responders **including law enforcement, fire fighters, front line social workers, people who work with high risk populations such as in homeless shelters.  
- **Teachers and childcare workers** including support staff.
- **Essential Workers from the Food and Agriculture industries **including those who must face the general public every day while working in grocery stores, restaurants, food banks, and food manufacturing.

To check the status of who the county is vaccinating, you can go [here](https://www.inyocounty.us/covid-19/vaccine-information) , as the availability changes frequently.

### [Feb 19] All of Phase 1A is eligible for the  vaccine in Nevada County. In Phase 1B, **vaccination of people 65+ countywide is the focus.**

If you have questions about which vaccination tier you fall into, call 211 Connecting Point at 1-833-DIAL211 to speak to a local call center agent, 24/7 in English or Spanish.

Clinics working with the County will reach out to eligible residents. Appointments will be released on [MyTurn.ca.gov](http://myturn.ca.gov/) 

You can also text VACCINEINFO to 898211 to receive text messages with updates on vaccine availability in Nevada County.
If you prefer email alerts, submit your email address via [this on-line form](https://forms.gle/6qNh6QHbhNKEWQQU8) to receive the same updates.

[Feb 17] Currently vaccinating phase 1a (healthcare workers) and county residents 65+. 
The county expects to open up eligibility to certain essential workers in Los Angeles County on March 1. These workers include educators and child-care workers; food and agriculture workers, which include grocery store employees; and law enforcement personnel and other emergency responders.
“We anticipate opening up many different sites and setting up special, what we call closed sites for all these sectors on March 1,” L.A. County Public Health Director Barbara Ferrer said during a briefing.

People currently eligible for vaccination can make appointments online <http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/acd/ncorona2019/vaccine/hcwsignup/> 
Residents can also call 833-540-0473 between 8:00 am and 8:30 pm 7 days a week to schedule an appointment.

DO NOT REGISTER FOR AN APPOINTMENT IF YOU ARE NOT IN AN ELIGIBLE GROUP. Doing so will take an appointment slot away from those at highest risk and you will be turned away without proper documentation of your eligibility.

Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/los_angeles>.

## [Jan 21] Phase 1A, all tiers (starting 1/29)
Starting 1/29: 
- Phase 1A, all tiers
- Residents age 75 years and over
- Residents age 64-74 with chrinic health conditions that put them at increased risk for severe COVID-19 illness

Individuals who cannot find an appointment are encouraged to contact their personal health care provider for vaccine information and availability.

The county states that at this time they will not be vaccinating persons that have any of the following at their COVID19 Mass Vax PODS (please confirm with the county for updates):
- Have a history of severe allergic reaction to medication, vaccines, food, or any other substance
- Have a bleeding disorder or are on blood thinners, this does not include persons taking daily baby aspirin
- Pregnant and breast-feeding women.

The county encourages these persons to contact their medical provider for vaccine information and availability.

## To make an appointment:
The county is hoping to share a press release with information about how to register for appointments by Friday, 1/22.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Trinity.html>

The county has a COVID-19 Vaccine line for questions or concerns at 530-623-8235.

A Frequently Asked Questions pages is available at <https://www.trinitycounty.org/COVID-19/Frequently-Asked-Questions>. The county encourages questions to be submitted through that site to help share information with others.

COVID-19 Mass Vax PODs will continue in Weaverville every 2-3 weeks as vaccine becomes available.

### [Feb19] Vaccinating Phase 1A- Tiers 1 - 3, and Phase 1B- Tiers 1-2.  People 65+, with 75+ prioritized.

[Feb 2] Currently vaccinating people 75 and older. A list of locations where you can make an appointment is here: <https://coronavirus.marinhhs.org/vaccine/status>

Marin County is facing an extreme shortage of vaccine supply. Only a few hundred first dose appointments are available each day for all vaccination locations in Marin. At this pace, it will take several weeks to complete vaccinations for the 75 & older age group. However, we remain hopeful supply will soon increase and we can open more vaccination locations in the coming weeks.

## To make an appointment: 
Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

Starting March 1, Marin County older adult residents – age 75 & older -- who have struggled to make their own COVID-19 vaccination appointments via the internet can call 833-641-1988 to get assistance from a real live human being. This phone line will operate Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., and is targeting those do not have internet connectivity or an at-home computer, tablet or smartphone.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Marin.html>

## To sign up for notifications: 
To receive notification on when you can receive a vaccine, you can submit the Marin County COVID Vaccination Interest Form at
<https://marincountyhc.jotform.com/210187732830049>. 

You can sign up for Marin County COVID-19 Status Update at <https://coronavirus.marinhhs.org/subscribe> or by texting "MARIN COVID" to 468311.

## County news: 
From the county's Jan 21 status update:
Over the past month, local interest in the COVID-19 vaccine has grown large, which bodes well for turning the pandemic tide in Marin County. Now, health officials are taking a coordinated step forward in how best to allocate a still-limited supply of the shots to those most vulnerable to hospitalization or death from COVID-19.

Marin County’s approximately 25,000 residents who are age 75 or above will be prioritized for available vaccine supplies. In parallel with this effort, vaccination of any remaining Phase 1A-eligible healthcare workers and residents of long-term care facilities will continue.  

You can read the county's full update at <https://coronavirus.marinhhs.org/covid-19-status-update-01212021>.

### [Feb 21] **_As of February 16, 2021, eligible populations are those in Phase 1A, all tiers and Phase 1B tier 1 with an emphasis on residents 75 and older._**_ _
The County has a**ssistance for those 75+ **who need extra help scheduling an appointment for the vaccine. **Call (530) 295-4101. **

The county has a form to sign up for notifications about phases/tier changes: <https://forms.gle/J152S7TYTv3pmDu97>

## To make an appointment:
Residents can be notified by email or text when they become eligible for a vaccine AND when an appointment becomes available. Signing up for the service is simple and takes less than 5 minutes. You'll get an email or text confirming your eligibility and another email or text when an appointment is available. It does not work with landline phones. Visit [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/) for more information. 

For the El Dorado Public Health Clinic locations, it will help the provider if you are able to fill out the Public Health Screening Registration Form before your appointment if possible. The form is available at <https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ENNOGV79vcD_TR2EN_hBRBdiO0H5II-5/view>.  

If you need help booking online, you can call 530-295-4101 or visit the Cameron Park Library, El Dorado Hills Library or Georgetown Library for assistance.

[Mar 4] Eligibility opened up to Phase 1A, all tiers of Phase 1B, and for those between 16 and 64 with comorbities.

Latest eligibility details are here:
<https://www.mendocinocounty.org/Home/Components/News/News/5412/3242>

# [Feb 9] Vaccinating Phase 1B Tier 1 (75+) 
Education and Childcare workers are on pause for now.

According the to county, at this time, all county vaccine clinics are closed. Based on anticipated supply, the next round of vaccine clinics will hopefully be scheduled for the 2nd week of February. Eligible Residents are encouraged to sign up via <https://www.plumascounty.us/2761/COVID-19-Vaccine>

## To make an appointment:
Dedicated Information Portal now available at <https://www.plumascounty.us/2761/COVID-19-Vaccine>

If you would like a COVID 19 vaccine you can provide your information via the Information Portal. For those with no internet access call 530-283-6188.

If you have already added your name to a waitlist at Plumas District Hospital, Eastern Plumas Health Care, or Seneca Healthcare District, your name has already been added to this information portal. Please call (530) 283-6188 to confirm your information.

If you have questions, need assistance, or do not have internet access, please call the Plumas County COVID-19 Vaccine Information Line at (530) 283-6188 during business hours (M-F 8 AM - 5 PM) for assistance. If calling during business hours, please leave a message and your call will be returned in 1-2 business days.

Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider or employer for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Plumas.html>

March 4 
  Currently vaccinating the following groups 65+, food and agricultural workers, emergency service workers, education and childcare workers.

At this point the Public Health Department is coordinating with some primary care providers to immunize their own patients.
If you are a patient at a County or Community Health Center, your health center will contact you about scheduling when the vaccine is available for you.
When you are eligible for a vaccine, and when vaccine supply is available, you will be able to make an appointment through your provider, a participating pharmacy, the local hospitals or at a County vaccination clinic.

[March 4] COVID-19 VACCINE is currently available to **Riverside County** **residents **and those **who work in Riverside County who are in **
**_Phase 1A – all tiers: _Healthcare workers and Long-term care residents**
**Phase 1B: Individuals 65 and older and the following Sector populations:**
·       **Agriculture and food**
·       **Education and childcare**
·       **Emergency services_ _**

**What is needed:**
-For workers in phase 1A and 1B– Tier 1, an appointment and worker id badge/letter from place of employment required or you will not be vaccinated
-For seniors 65 and older, an appointment and ID is required
-For seniors 65 years and older who need assistance, 
Please Dial 2-1-1 or 951-329-4703

**To register for an appointment:**
To register for an appointment at one of the Riverside County Public Health Clinics, FOR A FIRST DOSE, go here: 
[COVID-19 Vaccine (rivcoph.org)](https://www.rivcoph.org/COVID-19-Vaccine-with-Registration) or call **877-218-0381**

To be vaccinated at Riverside County Vaccination Partners:
Riverside Convention Center, Palm Springs Convention Center, Bob Glass Gym- Perris, or Desert Hot Springs, Norco, Temecula, you can register for an appointment here: [COVID-19 Vaccine (rivcoph.org)](https://www.rivcoph.org/COVID-19-Vaccine)

For SECOND DOSES:
For those who received a first dose at a county vaccine clinic, Riverside County health officials will reach out to residents through the **contact method provided at the first appointment**. At that time, the county will provide instructions for receiving the second dose conforming to the current CDC guideline on timeframes. 
Residents who received their first dose at a private provider, should contact that same provider to schedule their second dose.

For a list of **Community Providers Offering Vaccination Clinics In**
**Riverside County, go to: **[COVID-19 Vaccine Providers (rivcoph.org)](https://www.rivcoph.org/COVID-19-Vaccine-Providers)

[Mar 4] Vaccinating Phase 1A (healthcare and in-home support workers, all tiers), 1B and 1B2 (65+, education and childcare, emergency services, food and agriculture, those who are incarcerated in a congregate setting).

Also vaccinating individuals 18-64 years old with a developmental disability that places them at high risk to develop severe life-threatening illness or death from COVID-19 infection, or who have the following chronic health condition(s): Cancer, Chronic Kidney Disease, COPD, Down Syndrome, Heart Conditions (heart failure, coronary artery disease or cardiomyopathies), A weakened immune system from an organ transplant, Severe Obesity (BMI over 40 kg/m2), High-Risk Pregnancy, Sickle Cell Disease, Type 2 diabetes mellitus.

To schedule a vaccination appointment or join the waitlist, call the COVID WarmLine at 530-233-1350 or 530-640-3171 between 8 AM and 5 PM Monday - Thursday.

County anticipates providing 420 doses during the week of Mar 1-5.

[Feb 9] Vaccinating people 65+ years who live in the county and people who work in some sectors

Who is eligible for COVID-19 vaccine in Alpine County?
- All persons at least 65 years of age who live in Alpine County
- Persons who work in Alpine County in the following 3 sectors:
    - Education, including early childhood education and childcare
    - Emergency services(law enforcement, fire services)
    - Food and agriculture, including food services (restaurants and bars)
    - Other frontline essential workers as determined by interview

Where can I get vaccinations?
- Woodfords at the Alpine County Health Department Clinic
- Bear Valley, in the Perry Walther Building
- Washoe Tribal Health Center in Dresslerville

How do I make an appointment?
- Woodfords and Bear Valley –call the Warm Line at 530-694-1011
- Washoe Tribal Health Center –call 775-265-8622

More information here: <http://alpinecountyca.gov/DocumentCenter/View/4211/ACPHB-COVID-Vaccine-Update-12721?bidId=>

Individuals who are eligible to be vaccinated are encouraged to contact their personal healthcare provider for information for vaccine information and to check for availability.

You can also find most recent county-level information compiled by our volunteers by visiting <https://www.vaccinateca.com/counties/Alpine.html>
